content: I've made some instances here which I was surprised to not find; should all uses of related instances be refactored in mathlib? I feel like you're more likely to naturally have decidable_rel (|) in the parent monoid than decidable_eq (associates α), but files like unique_factorization_domain use the second. However, I can also see this messing with classical, especially if you use something like classical.dec_eq (associates α). What do people think?
